clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Anesthesia Type on Pulmonary Function
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of General or Spinal Anesthesia on Pulmonary Function Tests in Geriatric Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The role of neuraxial anesthesia in preventing respiratory complications is a controversial in elderly patients. The aim of the study was to evaluate the benefits of neuraxial anesthesia on pulmonary function during post-operative term in geriatric patients undergoing to elective non-abdominal surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Sixty elder patients will be randomly assigned to General anesthesia or Neuraxial anesthesia groups. Spirometry, will be performed at pre-operative and post-operative terms. Pulmonary function tests will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: The changes on forced vital capacity
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Preoperative, postoperative 2. hours, postoperative 24. hours
primary_outcome.description: Forced vital capacity will be measured via spirometer

primary_outcome.measure: The changes on forced expiratory volume in 1 s
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Preoperative, postoperative 2. hours, postoperative 24. hours
primary_outcome.description: Forced expiratory volume in 1 s will be measured via spirometer

primary_outcome.time_frame: At Preoperative, postoperative 2. hours, postoperative 24. hours
primary_outcome.description: mid-expiratory flow (MEF 25-75) will be measured via spirometer

primary_outcome.measure: The changes on peak expiratory flow (PEF)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Preoperative, postoperative 2. hours, postoperative 24. hours
primary_outcome.description: Peak expiratory flow (PEF) will be measured by the spirometer

arm_group.description: Standard General Anesthesia will be applied.The change of the pulmonary functions will be evaluated via spirometer.
Neuraxial anesthesia will be applied. The change of the pulmonary functions will be evaluated via spirometer.

intervention.description: induction with the intravenous anesthetic (Propofol) and maintenance with the inhalational anesthetic (Sevoflurane)
Spinal anesthesia will be applied via the local anesthetic ( Bupivacaine).
Pulmonary function will be evaluated via the portable spirometer (MIR Spirodoc, Spirodoc®, Roma, Italy)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 65 years of age
- Undergoing non-abdominal surgery under anesthesia in supine position
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pulmonary disease
- Hematological disease
- Undergoing Abdominal surgery
- Non-supine position during surgery
- Nicotine Abuse
